ai.summary: An 11.5 km moderate loop around Cliveden in the United Kingdom, featuring woodland trails, river views along the estate, and varied terrain. Suitable for hikers with moderate fitness; plan for roughly 3.5–4.5 hours depending on pace and stops.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain includes shaded woodland paths, gentle ascents, uneven footing, and a few stairs or gates near the estate. Expect a mix of grassy tracks, dirt paths, and compact surfaces; sections may be muddy after rain and near riverbanks.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and wear sturdy, waterproof footwear. Stay on marked paths and respect private property and estate boundaries. Bring a map or GPS and a fully charged phone; carry water and snacks. Be mindful of mud, slippery areas after rain, and riverbank edges. Dogs should be kept under control where required, and leave-no-trace practices apply.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April to October) offer the best conditions for scenery and footing; year round hiking is possible with appropriate footwear and weather gear, though winter can be muddy and visibility reduced.

seo.title: Cliveden Blue Walking Trail – 11.5 km Moderate Hike in Cliveden, UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Cliveden Blue Walking Trail, an 11.5 km moderate hike near Cliveden in the UK. Enjoy woodland paths, river views, and estate scenery along this UK walking route.
